title: How to enable debug log in Exchange Transport Agent
description: Use the following steps to generate a detailed log file from the Signature 365 Manager Transport Agent:

children.value: Use the following steps to generate a detailed log file from the Signature 365 Manager Transport Agent:
On your Exchange Server (where the transport agent is installed), start <span style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">regedit and navigate to the following registry key:
<span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Symprex\Signature 365 Exchange Agent
<span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">Log File
Leave blank for the time being*
<span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">Verbose Logging
<span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">Raw Data Logging
At this stage, no log file is being created.
Create a folder <span style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">C:\Temp and ensure all users have read/write access to it.
On a mobile device, prepare to send a test email that will invoke the unwanted behaviour but
do not send it as this point*.
On the Exchange Server, using <span style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">regedit, set the following entry:

This will cause the Transport Agent to start logging to a file <span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">C:\Temp<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Courier New"; font-size: 13px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal;  text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">S365.TransportAgent.LogFile.txt; it will grow large very quickly depending on the throughput of your server, so it should be configured for the shortest time possible to keep the log concise.

Send the test email to replicate the issue. Once it has been delivered, verify that the incorrect behaviour has occurred; this will ensure the log file has captured what the Transport Agent did when the email was processed.

In <span style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">regedit, clear the value of the <span style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">Log File entry (this will stop any further information being written to the log file).

Locate the file <span dir="ltr" style="box-sizing: border-box; font-family: "Courier New";">C:\Temp<span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0); font-family: "Courier New"; font-size: 13px; font-style: normal; font-variant-ligatures: normal; font-variant-caps: normal; font-weight: 400; letter-spacing: normal; orphans: 2; text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; text-transform: none; widows: 2; word-spacing: 0px; -webkit-text-stroke-width: 0px; white-space: normal;  text-decoration-thickness: initial; text-decoration-style: initial; text-decoration-color: initial; display: inline !important; float: none;">S365.TransportAgent.LogFile.txt, zip it up and email it to us.
Whilst logging is enabled, the details of

all* emails that are processed by the Transport Agent will be recorded. Therefore, wherever possible, it is recommended that this procedure is followed at a time when the Exchange Server is not busy to keep the log file as short and as concise as possible.
